Detailed Description

This header defines the GTI APIs for handling breakpoints on target device.

Copyright (c) 1998-2015, Texas Instruments Inc., All rights reserved.

Define Documentation

#define GTI_BRK_HWBP   0x00FF

Hardware breakpoint.

#define GTI_BRK_SHARED   0x2000

Breakpoint is already set in shared memory.

#define GTI_BRK_SHORT   0x1000

Short (ARM thumb mode) breakpoint.

#define GTI_BRK_SWBP   0x0000

Flags to define type of breakpoint to set or clear.

Used by GTI_SETBP_EX(), GTI_SETBP(), GTI_CLEARBP_EX(), GTI_CLEARBP(), and GTI_BP_TEST(). Software breakpoint.

#define TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_BP_EXT_EXPORT

Export attribute for GTI_SETBP_EX() and GTI_CLEARBP_EX().

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum GTI_BP_STAT

Flags for current state of a breakpoint used by GTI_BP_TEST().

Enumerator:
GTI_BP_STAT_VALID 

Breakpoint is still valid.

GTI_BP_STAT_INVALID 

Breakpoint is not valid.

Function Documentation

GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_BP_TEST ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize,
GTI_BP_STAT *  bpState 
)

GTI_BP_TEST() - Tests if a breakpoint is still set on target device.

This function tests whether or not a breakpoint is still set on the target device. This is primarily used when the device has been powered down in low power mode, and it may be possible that breakpoints in memory or even hardware breakpoint settings have been cleared.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error. State of breakpoint returned in bpState.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint to test.
[in]countCount before halting device.
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
[out]bpStatePointer to return state of breakpoint.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_CLEARBP ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count 
)

GTI_CLEARBP() - Clear a breakpoint on target device.

This function clears a breakpoint on target device.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint to clear.
[in]countCount before halting device.
TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_BP_EXT_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_CLEARBP_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize 
)

GTI_CLEARBP_EX() - Clear a breakpoint on target device.

This function clears a breakpoint on target device. This call extends the GTI_CLEARBP() call by by letting caller choose a specific access width for the memory access for clearing software breakpoints.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint to clear.
[in]countCount before halting device.
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_DONE_REMOVING_DEBUG_STATE ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid )

GTI_DONE_REMOVING_DEBUG_STATE() - Clears all breakpoints on target device.

This function clears all breakpoints that have been set on target device.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_ENABLE_GLOBAL_BKPTS ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  enableFlag 
)

GTI_ENABLE_GLOBAL_BKPTS() - Enable global breakpoints.

This function turns on or off the use of global breakpoints by the target device. When turned on, the target will halt in response to global events as triggered by the EMU0/1 pins on the emulation header. Set enableFlag to 1 to turn on global breakpoints. Set enableFlag to 0 to turn off global breakpoints.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]enableFlagFlag to turn on or off global breakpoints.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_STRING_TYPE GTI_GET_HBP_TYPE_NAME ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  hbpType 
)

GTI_GET_HBP_TYPE_NAME() - Gets the description of a hardware breakpoint type.

This function gets the description of a hardware breakpoint type where hbpType is the index of the type. Use GTI_NUM_HBP_TYPES() to get the range of indices for types (hardware breakpoint types start at index 1). Note that most drivers will return an empty string when only one type is supported.

Returns:
the description of a hardware breakpoint type.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]hbpTypeIndex to hardware breakpoint type.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_NUM_HBP_TYPES ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid )

GTI_NUM_HBP_TYPES() - Gets the number of types of hardware breakpoints.

This function gets the number of different types of hardware breakpoints supported by the driver and target device.

Returns:
number of types of hardware breakpoints.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_SETBP ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count 
)

GTI_SETBP() - Set a breakpoint on target device.

This function sets a breakpoint on target device. count is used to delay halting the target until a "count" number of times the breakpoint has been hit. count is only used with hardware breakpoints, for software breakpoints, you must set count to 1.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint to set.
[in]countCount before halting device.
TRG_MEMORY_ACCESS_SIZE_BP_EXT_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_SETBP_EX ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count,
GTI_INT_TYPE  accessSize 
)

GTI_SETBP_EX() - Set a breakpoint on target device.

This function sets a breakpoint on target device. This call extends the GTI_SETBP() call by by letting caller choose a specific access width for the memory access for setting software breakpoints.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint to set.
[in]countCount before halting device.
[in]accessSizeMemory access width.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_WAS_HBP_HIT ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_ADDRS_TYPE  address,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  bpType,
GTI_LEN_TYPE  count 
)

GTI_WAS_HBP_HIT() - Determines if target device hit a hardware breakpoint.

This function determines if the reason the target device halted is because it hit a hardware breakpoint.

Returns:
non-zero if hardware breakpoint was hit.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]addressBreakpoint address.
[in]bpTypeType of breakpoint.
[in]countCount before halting device.
